channel.title: Building My Own Pc
channel.description:
Hello!
I have been dreaming of building my own computer, and now i need your help. I am going to build a gaming computer and i don't know what exact parts to get. I have a few parts and i want you to tell me what you thing. I have built a computer before in my computer service and repair class, so I'm fine on that end.
So far i have this setup: [url=http://pcpartpicker.com/p/OaCy]http://pcpartpicker.com/p/OaCy[/url] I would like to know what i can change to make it cheaper, but the same or near the same output. I would like to run games in full graphics without lag. Please note that i already have a keyboard, mouse, and two monitors.
Thanks. (:

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

Alright, Thanks! Anymore comments or suggestions, feel free to post!

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“nickog15, post:25, topic:513191”]So this is my build so far, comments? http://pcpartpicker.com/p/OaCy

I already have two screens hooked up right now. I have a mouse and keyboard & a headset.[/quote]
Looks good for a budget build, only thing is I would swap out the GTX 650 Ti for the 650 Ti Boost, very recently released, it’s priced exactly the same, but has significantly more power, also can be installed in SLI unlike the regular Ti.
http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&DEPA=0&Order=BESTMATCH&N=-1&isNodeId=1&Description=gtx+650+boost&x=-1166&y=-112

Read full topic

@CoonHunter wrote:

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:22, topic:513191”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=631439.msg4276024#msg4276024 date=1364958341]

Get a 660 Ti 2GB if you’re not tight on budget, massive upgrade from a 660 2GB (almost 25% performance increase).

Also, an 8-core processor is a bit excessive. If you’re planning on having it for years without any upgrades I guess it’s reasonable, but I have yet to see a single combination of high-tier games that can use more than four cores.
[/quote]That doesn’t matter. If he wants to record or multi-task, more cores are better.

8 cores is still extremely excessive. That’s like saying get 128GB of ram instead of 64GB if you’re going to multitask

8 cores is far from excessive these days, considering most programs are able to use multi-threading, fibers, actors, ect, ect.

Yet two of my cores (hex-core) live on, completely untouched[/quote]

If you run more then your browser then you will see them used! Unless you have a dumb OS, it should spread everything so that you use all the cores.

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

If I right click computer and go to property’s and go to upgrade windows vista, I can apparently get windows 7… So once I get my new system I can just use the 286 GB HDD I have right now and “upgrade it” to windows 7, can I not?

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

With your new rig, I would use windows 7. You can either buy it or acquire it via other methods and mount it to a usb/disc. Your choice.

About the SSD/HDD, look and see how much space you are using right now. If I were you I’d go with a HDD

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

Ok so this is my list now: http://pcpartpicker.com/p/NWgw
Another question - The SSD - Do I need it? Would it be worth it to buy it? If I remove it the total will be $685
I have a HDD at home with a legit version of Vista Home Premium SP2, should/can I just pop that into the new laptop? Or buy new one / new OS(dad maybe can get free OS)…?

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

The 650, 660, and the 670 all can. If you’re in a tight budget for money I’d go with the 650, if not, go with the 660.

My crappy little $80 card can run almost everything in ultra settings with no lag. + I had a 660 and it runs anything and everything flawlessly.

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

What graphics card would you recommend for me to play black ops 2 in high graphics low-no lag?

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

The only way to build a future-proof computer is to spend an outrageous price on hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

I have black ops 2 right now. I have a compact computer, and it runs on low settings right now with lag. I want to run it in high without lag, and to be able to handle future games. I’m on Ethernet internet right now so I’m pretty sure its not my internet. Is there anything in my router that i need to change for it to run better?

Here is what i want right now, is there anything i should change?
http://pcpartpicker.com/p/NSy1

I want a duo monitor system, I have two at the minute and want to keep it that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

nickog15:

I would like to run games in full graphics without lag.

Good luck.

What games in particular anyway? Certainly won’t get that with a GTX 650.

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

I’d get a 2GB 650 Ti. The 660 is too expensive compared to the 650 for how little of a performance boost there is

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“nickog15, post:6, topic:513191”]I almost have re-made my list. One question
ASUS GTX650TI-1GD5 GeForce GTX 650 Ti 1GB 128-bit GDDR5 PCI Express 3.0 x16 HDCP Ready Video Card
Vs.
EVGA GeForce GTX 660 Ti 2GB Video Card

Or something better? I heard you should spend most of your money on a good graphics card…[/quote]
Not ‘most of your money’ search for a deal if you can. Just search for the best one that you can afford to buy for the price.

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

If I were you i would go with the 660

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

The key is to not pay more than you have to for specific parts and buy an AMD processor.

http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&N=100011693%20600414917&IsNodeId=1&name=91GB%20-%20128GB&cm_sp=SSD119--VisNav--128GB
http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&N=100007671%2050001028%20600213780&IsNodeId=1&name=FX-Series
http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&DEPA=0&Order=BESTMATCH&N=100006662&isNodeId=1&Description=GTX+670&x=0&y=0
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813130637

Total: Like $600

Read full topic

item.title: Building My Own Pc
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Are you sure you want to go with a SSD? The speed is amazing, but the space is quite low and if you are expecting to game on it, you will probably need more space.

@Lil_Smok3r, 1k for a PC is actually reasonably low.

Also, @OP, don’t get that gfx card. You can get a different one and cut the price almost in half.

Read full topic
